name: cfheader
description: Generates custom HTTP response headers to return to the client.

params.name: name
params.description:
Header name
 Required if statusCode not specified

params.name: charset
params.description:
The character encoding in which to encode the header value.

 For more information on character encodings, see:
 www.w3.org/International/O-charset.html.

params.name: statuscode
params.description:
HTTP status code
 Required if name not specified

links.title: List of HTTP Header Fields
links.description: Wikipedia page listing standard HTTP headers. This page lists both HTTP request headers and HTTP response headers. You can only set HTTP Response headers with cfheader, request headers are sent by the user agent (the browser).

examples.title: Set a HTTP Response Header
examples.description: Use cfheader to return a Content-Security-Policy HTTP response header.

examples.title: Return a Custom Status Code and Status Text
examples.description: Uses cfheader to return a 405 Method Not Allowed status when method is not POST.
examples.code:
<cfif uCase(cgi.request_method) IS NOT "POST">
    <cfheader statuscode="405" statustext="Method Not Allowed">
    Sorry POST only.<cfabort>
</cfif>

examples.title: Content-Type header in CFScript
examples.description: CFScript syntax to return a JSON content type header.
